cohort: Metastatic Colorectal Cancer, RAS/BRAF Wild Type, Q1 2023
summary: EGFR inhibitor utilization is at 65% for eligible patients with RAS/BRAF wild type mCRC, below NCCN guidelines recommendation of 80%.
recommendation: Increase appropriate utilization of EGFR inhibitors in RAS/BRAF wild type mCRC patients.
financial_impact_description: Optimizing EGFR inhibitor use could improve outcomes and generate approximately $250,000 in annual savings through improved progression-free survival.
peer_financial_impact_description: Your organization trails peer benchmarks, with a potential financial opportunity of $320,000 annually.
action_steps: Review molecular testing protocols to ensure all eligible patients receive RAS/BRAF testing
Implement clinical decision support alerts for eligible patients
Conduct provider education on NCCN guidelines for mCRC
peer_action_steps: Monitor both testing rates and appropriate EGFR inhibitor use
